page.title: 10Language, Isle of Skye
page.content: Many of our local place names are derived from Gaidhlig or Norse. This area was occupied by the Vikings. Waternish-Bhatairnis(Gaidhlig) means the headland jutting out into the sea. Gaidhlig(Gaelic)is spoken by all but the present generation of locals. However,most of the youngsters have a fair knowledge and understanding of the language. Until recently, when children first came to school they spoke only Gaidhlig; picking English up as they went along. This was of course very necessary as all teaching was conducted in English. Nowadays, however, a very definate effort is being made through the Bi-lingual unit to regenerate Gaidhlig in the community, through the schools. .All in-coming children learn Gaidhlig.
